case_title: The GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN through Secretary (Revenue), Board of Revenue, Balochistan, Quetta and 3 others vs Haji SAWAL KHAN and 4 others
appellant: The GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN through Secretary (Revenue), Board of Revenue, Balochistan, Quetta
complaint_summary: Respondents filed a suit for declaration and permanent injunction claiming ownership and possession of 173 acres of land purchased in 1964. They alleged illegal mutation entries transferring 128 acres to the Government without notice.
investigation_summary: Respondents provided evidence of possession and ownership, including witness testimonies and documents proving uninterrupted possession since 1964. Government's claim was based on mutation entries, which were found to be made without notice.
judgment_summary: The appeal was dismissed. The court upheld the respondents' ownership and possession of the disputed property, ruling that the mutation entries made in favor of the appellants were illegal and violated principles of natural justice.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal dismissed; respondents' ownership and possession upheld.
legal_arguments: Respondents argued uninterrupted possession since 1964 and violation of natural justice in mutation entries.
Appellants contended the suit was time-barred and based on an unregistered agreement.
assets: 173 acres of land in Mauza Arbiseen and Rodleen Tehsil Bori, District Loralai

witness_statement.P.W.1: Confirmed execution of agreement dated 22-12-1964 and possession transfer.
witness_statement.P.W.6: Affirmed sale and possession transfer by Haji Khan.
witness_statement.D.W.1: Admitted sale of personal property but denied sale of Government property.

key_issues: Ownership and possession of disputed land
Violation of principles of natural justice

maxims.Natural Justice: No one should be condemned unheard.

legal_terms.Mutation: Entry in revenue records indicating ownership or possession of land.
legal_terms.Specific Relief: Legal remedy for enforcing civil rights.

words_and_phrases.Possession: Physical control or occupancy of property.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around disputed land ownership and possession. Respondents proved uninterrupted possession since 1964 and illegal mutation entries made without notice. The court upheld their claims and dismissed the appeal.
